The village of Sepupa could be reached by a bus from

. The bus runs three times a day from the bus rank in Maun. As of June 2011 the bus fare was 63.60 pula per person (about $9.80 USD). The daily departure times from Maun are 8:30am, 11:00am, and 16:30pm. Look for the bus with the destination sign for Shakawe. Sepupa is just couple stops before

. There are no ticket counters at the bus rank, so the tickets cannot be purchased ahead of time. The ticket payment is collected right on the bus. The bus is pretty basic: 5 non-reclining seats in a row, little leg-room and no bathrooms .The bus ride takes about 4.5 hrs and the bus drops you off in Sepupa next to a little store (about 3km from the Swamp Stop and the shore river bank). If you are headed to Swamp Stop, ask to be dropped off by the turn with a sing “Swamp Stop”. Once in Sepupa, you will have to rely on flagging down a vehicle to give you a lift to the Swamp Stop. Keep in mind that sometimes part of the road to Swamp Stop gets flooded and the only way to get over is to have someone from the Swamp Stop to fetch you on a mokoro boat or on a tractor; so phone ahead of time or have a mobile handy.

value: . telephone: 687-7073. There are camping sites and permanent tents (as of June 2011 the price of a permanent tent was 200 pula + tax). The showers have hot water, the restaurant serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and there is a licensed bar. Also, the upstairs of the restaurant offers a nice shaded space to sit and watch the river flow by.
